str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A soldier. From a presumed derivative of the same as stratia; a camper-out, i.e. A warrior.

Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To break down (in pieces), crush, break into. From kata and the base of rhegnumi; to rend in pieces, i.e. Crack apart.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The leg (from the hip downwards). Apparently from skello; the leg.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
First, before, principal, most important. Contracted superlative of pro; foremost.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

str2: To crucify together with. From sun and stauroo; to impale in company with.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Other, another (of more than two), different. A primary word; 'else, ' i.e. Different.
